definitions: strong lightweight fabric made from fibers of the flax plant
collective term for household items made from fabric like sheets and tablecloths
examples: The white linen shirt felt cool against his skin
She preferred linen curtains for their natural texture
We need to wash all the bed linen this weekend
The hotel provides fresh linen for each guest

definitions: large ship designed for carrying passengers on regular routes across oceans
material used to cover the inside surface of something for protection
examples: The ocean liner departed from Southampton with thousands aboard
They booked a cabin on a luxury liner for their anniversary
The jacket has a warm fleece liner for winter
She placed a plastic liner in the trash can

definitions: official who assists the referee by watching the sidelines in football or tennis
examples: The linesman raised his flag to signal an offside
Both linesmen agreed the ball was out of bounds

definitions: group of people or things arranged in a row or particular order
examples: The witness identified the suspect from the police lineup
The festival announced an impressive lineup of performers

definitions: women's underwear and nightclothes typically made from delicate fabrics
examples: She bought silk lingerie for her honeymoon trip
The store specializes in luxury lingerie and sleepwear

definitions: the act or state of staying somewhere or continuing longer than expected
examples: There was a lingering of guests after the party ended
The lingering of doubt made her reconsider the decision

definitions: informal term for the specialized vocabulary used by a particular group
examples: Medical students quickly learn the lingo of their profession
I don't understand all the technical lingo in this manual

definitions: person who studies languages scientifically or speaks several languages fluently
examples: The linguist analyzed the structure of ancient languages
As a skilled linguist, she worked as a UN translator

definitions: layer of material covering the inside surface of something like clothing or containers
examples: The coat's silk lining made it comfortable to wear
The silver lining of the box protected the delicate contents

definitions: system of connections between things or the state of being connected
examples: The linkage between poverty and crime is well documented
The mechanical linkage transfers motion from the engine to wheels

definitions: shortened informal term for linoleum floor covering
examples: They replaced the old lino in the kitchen last year
The bathroom lino needs cleaning with special products

definitions: durable floor covering made from linseed oil, cork dust, and other materials on canvas backing
examples: The vintage kitchen still has its original linoleum flooring
Linoleum is making a comeback as an eco-friendly flooring option

definitions: seed of the flax plant used to make oil and as a dietary supplement
examples: Artists use linseed oil to thin their paint
She adds ground linseed to her morning smoothie

definitions: small fibers or fluff that come off fabric or accumulate in pockets
examples: He brushed the lint off his black sweater
The dryer filter was clogged with lint

definitions: horizontal support beam placed across the top of a door or window opening
examples: The stone lintel above the entrance dates from medieval times
They had to replace the wooden lintel due to rot

definitions: colored cosmetic product applied to lips to add color and texture
examples: She chose a bright red lipstick for the evening
The lipstick left marks on the coffee cup

definitions: sweet alcoholic beverage made by adding sugar and flavorings to distilled spirits
examples: They served coffee liqueur after the dinner party
The bartender recommended a fruit liqueur for dessert

definitions: substance that flows freely and takes the shape of its container
examples: Water is the most common liquid on Earth
The medicine comes in liquid form for easier swallowing

definitions: process of closing a business and selling its assets to pay debts
conversion of assets into cash through selling
examples: The company went into liquidation after years of losses
The liquidation sale offered deep discounts on inventory
The estate liquidation raised funds for the heirs
They handled the liquidation of the investment portfolio

definitions: person appointed to oversee the closing of a company and distribution of its assets
examples: The court appointed a liquidator to handle the bankruptcy
The liquidator sold all company assets at auction

definitions: measure of how easily assets can be converted to cash or the availability of liquid assets
examples: The bank maintains high liquidity to meet customer withdrawals
Market liquidity affects how quickly stocks can be sold

definitions: distilled alcoholic drink such as whiskey, vodka, or rum
examples: The store has a wide selection of imported liquor
He doesn't drink liquor, only beer and wine

definitions: black candy or flavoring made from the root of the liquorice plant
examples: Children either love or hate the taste of liquorice
She bought liquorice sweets from the candy shop

definitions: former basic monetary unit of Italy before the adoption of the euro
examples: He collected old lira coins as a hobby
The price was listed in both lira and euros

definitions: speech difficulty where 's' and 'z' sounds are pronounced like 'th'
examples: The child's lisp made some words hard to understand
Speech therapy helped correct her lisp over time

definitions: number of people who regularly listen to a radio station or podcast
examples: The radio show's listenership grew after the new host arrived
Podcast listenership has increased dramatically in recent years

definitions: the action of paying attention to sounds or what someone is saying
examples: Active listening improves communication in relationships
The listening exercise helped students improve their language skills

definitions: person who compiles or maintains lists of items or information
examples: The bird lister recorded every species seen that day
As the lister for the auction, she catalogued each item

definitions: organized written record of items or information in list form
advertisement for property that is for sale or rent
examples: Check the listing of ingredients on the package
The directory listing shows all files in the folder
The real estate listing included photos of every room
Their house listing attracted multiple offers immediately

definitions: informal abbreviation for literature as an academic subject
examples: She majored in English lit at university
The lit class discussed contemporary poetry this week

definitions: long repetitive list or recital of items, especially complaints or prayers
examples: He recited a litany of complaints about the service
The priest led the congregation in the traditional litany

definitions: metric unit of volume equal to one thousand cubic centimeters
examples: The recipe calls for one liter of milk
Gas prices are shown per liter at the station

definitions: the most basic or primary meaning of a word without metaphor or exaggeration
examples: The literal translation doesn't capture the idiom's meaning
He took her words in their literal sense

definitions: person who can read and write or is well-educated
examples: The program aims to help every adult become literate
As a literate in computer programming, she found work easily

definitions: well-educated people interested in literature and the arts collectively
examples: The cafe was a gathering place for local literati
The literati debated the merits of the new novel

definitions: soft silver-white metal element used in batteries and psychiatric medication
examples: Lithium batteries power most modern smartphones
The doctor prescribed lithium for bipolar disorder treatment

definitions: print made by drawing on limestone and using it to reproduce the image
examples: The museum displayed original lithographs by famous artists
She bought a limited edition lithograph at the gallery

definitions: printing process using a flat stone or metal plate with a design drawn in greasy substance
examples: Lithography revolutionized the printing industry in the 19th century
The artist specializes in fine art lithography techniques

definitions: rigid outer layer of the Earth consisting of the crust and upper mantle
examples: Tectonic plates are part of the Earth's lithosphere
The lithosphere floats on the semi-fluid asthenosphere below

definitions: person involved in a lawsuit either as plaintiff or defendant
examples: Both litigants agreed to settle out of court
The litigant presented evidence to support her claim

definitions: process of taking legal action or resolving disputes in court
examples: The company faces litigation over the defective product
They want to avoid costly litigation if possible

definitions: lawyer who specializes in taking cases to court and arguing them
examples: The experienced litigator won most of her cases
He hired a skilled litigator to represent him

definitions: British spelling of liter, a metric unit of volume
examples: The bottle contains two litres of water
Fuel efficiency is measured in litres per hundred kilometers

definitions: waste material carelessly dropped in public places
group of young animals born to one mother at the same time
examples: Please don't drop litter in the park
Volunteers collected litter from the beach yesterday
The cat had a litter of five kittens
The entire litter was adopted within a week

definitions: prescribed form of public worship used in religious services
examples: The morning liturgy follows ancient traditions
Different denominations have their own liturgy styles

definitions: way of earning money needed to pay for food, housing, and other necessities
examples: Fishing provides a livelihood for many coastal families
The drought threatened farmers' livelihoods across the region
